summary:
A unique race with a unique & very slender bodyreplacer, and a storage with several armors & clothes.
warning: adult contend!
descriptionHtml:
[img]http://www.ld-host.de/uploads/images/fd3b89abdb1e96374117d12f44ba05e1.jpg[/img]

[img]http://www.ld-host.de/uploads/images/fbd6580f2238ceb3998596d8240055c4.jpg[/img]


Name: HN66s Litheria - Race BodyReplacer Armors
( http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/25461 )

Version: 1.11 / 2.0.1
Date: 02-16-2013
Category: Bodyreplacer & Armors
Requirements: Skyrim (Dawnguard is not required)
Author: Humannature66 & Ginnyfizz
*********************************************************************************



[img]http://www.ld-host.de/uploads/images/c06bea073009b348dacd32d3fb573fb5.jpg[/img]

This mod adds a unique race with a unique & very slender bodyreplacer, and a storage with several armors & clothes to your game.
Note: This body-model is NOT recommended as all-around-bodyreplacer, but as custombody.
We will upgrade and extend the storage, so watch out for updates.
warning: adult contend!




[i]INFO
====
These armors will NOT work with any other bodyreplacer, and there will be NO conversions for any other bodyreplacer, no request needed for that.[/i][/size]


[color=#e69138][b]
(11-07-2015)
[size=4]
[color=#ff0000]!! NEW VERSION !![/color]
[color=#000000][size=5][i]*Skyrim Litheria-BBP-body*[/i][/size][/color][/size]
[color=#ff7700]Details:
========
New made *Skyrim Litheria-BBP-body* as upgrade to my Litheria-body-mod.


Due to release of Fallout 4 next week, i will upload the *Skyrim Litheria-BBP-body* as own package today. My final for Skyrim.[/color]


[color=#ff7700][size=4]INSTALL of the body-pack "[color=#000000]HN[/color][color=#000000]66-1[/color][color=#000000]_Litheria_Race_BBP-BODY[/color]":[/size][/color]
[color=#ff7700]--------------------------------------------------------------------------
Just like the original pack. Copy & paste, simple as that. Overwrite when prompted.
(I don't use NMM nor do i have it installed, thus i have no clue how it works. Definitely NO support on NMM from my side.)

Requirements:
*HDT HighHeels System by hydrogensayshdt*
http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/36213/?
[/color][/b][color=#ff7700][color=#f9cb9c][size=2]My mod's HighHeels need a custom height of 6.5 in *HDT HighHeels*s MCM[/size][/color][size=2]
[/size][/color][b][color=#ff7700]
*XP32 Maximum Skeleton - XPMS by xp32*
http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/26800/?
[/color][/b][color=#ff7700][color=#f9cb9c][size=2]If you wanna use your own favourite custom skeleton, first install my body-mod, then copy & paste (overwrite when prompted) your favourite custom Skeleton due to these paths:
C:\Program Files (x86)\Steam\SteamApps\common\Skyrim\Data\Meshes\HN66\Litheria Skeletons\skeleton_female.nif
C:\Program Files (x86)\Steam\SteamApps\common\Skyrim\Data\Meshes\HN66\Litheria Skeletons\skeletonbeast_female.nif[/size][/color][/color][b][color=#ff7700]


Those who like the original Litheria-Body, will probably LOVE this new one. Myself, i definitely doÂ  ;)
The new skin is a fitted variant of Maevan's skin-tex. Warning: Some details are highly adult-oriented![/color]

=================================================================

[color=#ff7700][size=4]
INSTALL of the Outfit-pack "[color=#000000]HN[/color][color=#000000]66-1[/color][color=#000000]_Litheria_BBP_OUTFITS[/color]":[/size][/color]
[color=#ff7700]-------------------------------------------------------------------------
Install manually (or via NMM).
It comes as BSA and ESP.
Nothing of the original Litheria-outfits or Temple-contents will be touched or overwritten by this, it's a stand-alone-mod.

Location: In Whiterun's Hall of Dead, beside it's the Shrine of Arkay, behind the left sided bench. A simple chest with all the stuff.
I had in mind to update to a better location first, but i won't find the time anymore.
The stuff is mostly NOT additionally craftable, and the inventar-models do not fit. I don't care tho, important for me were only the ingame-outfits. Use them as they are, there won't be any upgrade. But it works nicely imo.
Btw., the original Litheria outfits in the Temple will mostly have clipping on the BBP-body, due to reshape of wider hips, jiggling breasts and reshaped thighs. But few original outfit-parts are still usable on this new body.

The BBP-outfit-parts are named by their [i]used bodyslots[/i] and thus [i]sorted by numbers[/i]:
31 for headwear
37 for footwear
46 for piercings
49 for nails
50 for corsages
55 for upperbody
etc. ..
[/color]
[/b][/color]
[img]http://www.ld-host.de/uploads/images/464f4982d45463a3bed8c05a0d6436df.jpg[/img]

The mod is separated into two parts:

The *Litheria* Race & Body
--------------------------
When using this mod, your female game-character will be different from all other characters in Skyrim;
She will have a unique body-shape, and unique skin, glowing eyes, pointed teeth, real finger- & toenails, and own unique abilities.
She'll be the only girl in Skyrim with that superslender figure, to wear the armors, outfits and accessories you can obtain in the Temple of Litheria. And she will also be slim as werewolf ;)
Litherias have a bonus on sneaking and silent moving, thus they are perfect nighthunters & assassins.
But: There is only ONE bodyshape - no weightslider. Why? Read the FAQs.
The mod is Dawnguard-compatible, tho the Dawngurd-DLC is not required!


The *Temple of Litheria* - a storage with armors (VERS. 2.0)
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Inside you will find some chests, filled with armors and outfits, all in parts, for mix and match, also a few mannequins to throw some of the stuff on them.
Go and find your favourite ... or maybe go naked, your choice ;)



IMPORTANT:
The body itself is exactly as i want it, and i'm NOT interested in opinions or critics.
I'm aware, that this is not everyone's cup of tea, and i'm ok with that.
So, If you do not like the body or the body-shape, then please leave without a comment.
This stated, i will report every kinda trolling, flaming or inappropriate remark.
(HN66)


[img]http://www.ld-host.de/uploads/images/1d141a856c62e3e0ce3072e803d986c7.jpg[/img]

A check of your map, after your escape from Helgen, will show you the location of the Temple of Litheria, north and not that far from you.
It is marked as Dwemer-Ruin, and show up on your HUD as far as you are out of Helgen.




[img]http://www.ld-host.de/uploads/images/059356c8305ce7766ab84fcf25f43c93.jpg[/img]

I recommend to install manually, don't use NMM.
Well, you only need the ability of copy & paste :)

It is important to use EXACTLY the same folder-structures as they are given in the mod-packs!
Any little mistake in paths or a misspelled foldernames will result in a non-working mod!

NOTE: If a required folder already exists, copy the new contents into it.
If a required folder does not exist, you need to create it.


1.
Unzip and extract the "LitheriaRaceAndBodyPack111" to any temporary folder.

2.
Copy the contents into the designated folders, exactly the way you find them given in the mod-pack.

3.
Then unzip and extract the "LitheriaArmorPack_20" to any temporary folder.

4.
Copy the contents into the designated folders, exactly the way you find them given in the mod-pack.

5.
Activate both esps in your launcher.

--------------------------------------------------------------



[img]http://www.ld-host.de/uploads/images/cd9f7e251ba376ee93304cffb749e426.jpg[/img]

Delete all files, associated with the mod.



[img]http://www.ld-host.de/uploads/images/b4a5547ed8bc3ad0fb40cf328978e526.jpg[/img]
none that i know of;



[img]http://www.ld-host.de/uploads/images/06aa3d760da52006eda57aff7df4f023.jpg[/img]

[i]Q: Why does this body-mod inlcude only one bodyshape?[/i]
A: That is due to four reasons.
First, by now there are several bodyreplacers in the nexus, all more or less similar, with bodyshapes from normal to big, so i saw no reason to make another one.
Besides, the intention never was to make an all-around-body-replacer, but a custom-race-body.
Second, the 'heavy' body would get a pretty 'bulky' shoulder-neck-part, to make it fit to the bigger neck-seam, when u set the slider on heavy. On that (still being slender) body it looks absurd. So, slider on 'light' and everything's fine. .. at least to my taste :)
Third, originally this was never ment to be released at all, and so i made only one bodyshape - to my own liking.
When i decided to eventually release it, due to some requests, some of the armors were already completed.
Fourth and finally, making outfits for two body-shapes means ~50 percent more work, and as it's likely that i will be the only one doing outfits for the Litheria ... well, enough work for me anyway ;)
So, the Litheria comes in one shape only - lithe and superslender, the try to build a model-like body.

[i]Q: Is the Litheria-body compatible with any other body?[/i]
A: Superslim as it is, the connections of hands & feet might not match that perfectly to other bodies, but that belongs to the respective Bodymodel. The weightslider needs to be set to "light" in any case.

[i]Q: Is it possible to wear other armors than those i can find in the Temple?[/i]
A: Litheria-babes can wear most of Skyrim's standard-armors, and many of the Outfits created by other modders, especially those made for UNP, as the texture-layout is very similar.

[i]Q: Does that also mean i can use the skin of any other body-model maybe?[/i]
A: As the Litheria-body is made from the original game-bodymesh, like most body-replacers, other body-textures might almost fit. Important is, that the texture-layout is close to the vanilla-body.

[i]Q: The mannequins are very dull & unreflective.[/i]
A: That gets fixed as soon as u put any item into their inventory.

[i]Q: The mannequins don't wear vanilla-items or any other mod's item ?![/i]
A: Those babes can only wear those items, which are assigned to their race.
Thus they wear only Litheria-items.
If u want them to also wear any non-Litheria-items, then those need to be assigned in the armor-mod's esp.
Don't ask me, you gotta do that urself.

[i]Q: How can i get more numbers of the armor-parts?![/i]
A: A procedure to multiply the temple's items:
1. look for any aside standing chest and put the part, which u wanna multiply, into it.
2. open the console (hit the ^-key), and click on the chest.
3. now type INV , which will show you whatz inside the chest, and voila - u will find the item and it's code.
4. now type ADDITEM xxxxxxxxxxx 3 (where that xxxxxxxxx is that item-code, and 3 will be the number of copies u will get), and hit enter.



[img]http://www.ld-host.de/uploads/images/1db0ecb0eb88b1d097c8105437023ed8.jpg[/img]
Some armorparts could clip, if you use them simultaniously, but you'll surely find out which fit together well.
Besides that, both mods are tested on different rigs, and showed NO problem at all.


Recommendations:
================
If you wanna be a vampire, we recommend the use of the "Better Vampires"-mod.
(http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/9717)


[img]http://www.ld-host.de/uploads/images/3f19c3d8a29478702cab8fa3955f5ada.jpg[/img]
You can find us on the Nexus as Humannature66 and Ginnyfizz.
if u need technical help with this, use the thread or contact us via pm;



[img]http://www.ld-host.de/uploads/images/9b555c9e239ecf0d03b42869f12c9a3f.jpg[/img]
